item.itemvalue: ScalaTest.AccountRepoSpec.Getting an account aggregate by its id should return the aggregate

ScalaTest.AccountRepoSpec.Saving an aggregate should persist its unsaved events to the event service
ScalaTest.AccountAggregateSpec.Creating an account should add an AccountCreated event
ScalaTest.AccountAggregateSpec.Transfering money to another account should withdraw from this account, deposit into destination account, and create a transfer event

task.summary: apply event after adding to event service insted of mutating balance directly
teach account reader how to handle events and keep state. get rid of getBalance and have clients just look at reader's balance.
error handling for invalid account id on transfer
Synchronize on account aggregate deposit, withdraw, and transfer
BIG Refactor - make account aggregates keep track of unsaved changes. Have repo.save get those changes and persist them to event store.
Repo will clear unsaved events when an account is saved
Test cleanup for Account Aggregate transfer specs
Refactor AccountReader to keep track of interest and fees in state instead of querying the eventstore
Clean up eventservice finder methods to return just events, not timestamps with them

MESSAGE.value: apply event after adding to event service insted of mutating balance directly
teach account reader how to handle events and keep state. get rid of getBalance and have clients just look at reader's balance.

Synchronize on account aggregate deposit, withdraw, and transfer

Repo will clear unsaved events when an account is saved

Refactor AccountReader to keep track of interest and fees in state instead of querying the eventstore
Clean up eventservice finder methods to return just events, not timestamps with them
